result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis Lee Tinnon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying A Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay fine in the amount of $100.00 inclusive of ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges PAYABLE IN THREE MONTHS.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs fees, and surcharges.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on AUGUST 9TH, 2022 and pay the DNA surcharge IN ADDITION TO THE $100.00 FINE.
Any cash bond on deposit to be applied.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dennis Lee Tinnon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dennis Lee Tinnon in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/Elements of the Offense.

AS TO COUNT 1 

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 
  Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Pay fine in the amount of $100.00 inclusive of ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges PAYABLE IN THREE MONTHS. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on AUGUST 9TH, 2022 and pay the DNA surcharge IN ADDITION TO THE $100.00 FINE.

Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Sam Obscherning in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in Court for plea/sentencing hearing. Defendant is not present. Case was originally scheduled for 6/9/22 at 4:00pm. Defense believes this may be a mix up of time for his client and requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request.  Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
At the request of the court, case is rescheduled. Parties notifed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Dennis Lee Tinnon in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dennis Lee Tinnon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Dennis Lee Tinnon in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dennis Lee Tinnon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests status conference date by zoom.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dennis Lee Tinnon in court.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/4/22 @ 1:30p
